abstract: Does General Electric need to put aside more cash to handle bad loans at its finance arm? G.E. says it doesn’t — it even insists it has higher loan loss reserves than the biggest banks. But investors are not fully convinced, Breakingviews.com writes.
snippet: Does General Electric need to put aside more cash to handle bad loans at its finance arm? G.E. says it doesn’t — it even insists it has higher loan loss reserves than the biggest banks. But investors are not fully convinced, Breakingviews.com writ...
lead_paragraph: Does General Electric need to put aside more cash to handle bad loans at its finance arm? G.E. says it doesn’t — it even insists it has higher loan-loss reserves than the biggest banks. But investors are not fully convinced. A look at just one small slice of GE Capital’s $650 billion of assets suggests why, Breakingviews.com writes.

headline.main: Bad Loans at G.E., or Sufficient Reserves?
